summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley, discussing a forwarded message about the resignation of Willis Knuckles, a government minister in Liberia, due to a sex scandal. The email highlights the public reaction to the scandal and the implications for the involved parties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the sender of the email and is involved in forwarding information regarding a political scandal.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is the recipient of the email from Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a communication between associates.

persons.name: Willis Knuckles
persons.context: Willis Knuckles is mentioned as the top government minister in Liberia who resigned over a sex scandal.

persons.name: Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf
persons.context: Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf is referenced as the president who commented on the resignation of Willis Knuckles, expressing regret but emphasizing the need for accountability.

connections.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley are in communication regarding political matters, indicating a professional relationship.
Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf is the president and Willis Knuckles is her minister, indicating a formal government relationship.

events.title: Resignation of Willis Knuckles
events.description: Willis Knuckles resigned from his position as a government minister in Liberia due to a sex scandal.

keyFacts: Willis Knuckles resigned over a sex scandal involving explicit photos published by a local newspaper.
Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf expressed regret over Knuckles' resignation but stated that she could not condone improper behavior.
The publication of the explicit photos was considered a violation of Liberia's penal code.
